_comment: Created by ianb on 08/10/2013 13:48:33 using v0.9
title: How has the proportion of respondents reporting lack of support changed by support type?
analysis_commentary: Of all the support types surveyed, help in finding or keeping work was the least supported, as reported by the surveyed patients in both years (43% of patients said they did not get any support in 2011 and 2012). The proportion of people who received no support for care responsibilities increased by 4.0% between the two years. The proportion of people who received no support for finding or keeping accommodation, and no support with financial advice or benefits, both decreased by 1.0%. The lowest proportion of people not receiving support in both years is those needing support for physical health needs, although this increased by 5.0% in the last year surveyed.
data_source: Care Quality Commission, Community Mental Health Survey
